code: Q.forecastErrorCov(   layers,   variableCovarianceFunction,   Q.backgroundErrorStandardDeviation,   Q.characteristicCorrelationLength,   neighbourhood,   compartmentsReported = 2 )

title: Create a Q-matrix — Q.forecastErrorCov
text: Bryce Carson Ashok Krishnmaurthy Michael Myer Thomas White

title: Create a Q-matrix — Q.forecastErrorCov
code: subregionsSpatVector <- terra::vect(   system.file(     "extdata",     ## COD: Nord-Kivu and Ituri (Democratic Republic of Congo)     "subregionsSpatVector",     package = "spatialEpisim.foundation",     mustWork = TRUE   ) ) susceptibleSpatRaster <- terra::rast(   system.file(     "extdata",     "susceptibleSpatRaster.tif", # Congo population     package = "spatialEpisim.foundation",     mustWork = TRUE   ) ) layers <- getSVEIRD.SpatRaster(subregionsSpatVector,                                susceptibleSpatRaster,                                aggregationFactor = 35) Ituri.Q.forecastErrorCov <- Q.forecastErrorCov(layers, "DBD", 2, 0.8, 4, 2)

what: SVEIRD compartmental model with optional Bayesian data assimilation — SVEIRD.BayesianDataAssimilation
title: SVEIRD compartmental model with optional Bayesian data assimilation — SVEIRD.BayesianDataAssimilation
text: Run SVEIRD compartmental model epidemic, optionally using Bayesian data assimilation.

title: SVEIRD compartmental model with optional Bayesian data assimilation — SVEIRD.BayesianDataAssimilation
code: SVEIRD.BayesianDataAssimilation(   alpha,   beta,   gamma,   sigma,   delta,   n.days,   seedData,   neighbourhood.order = 0,   lambda,   layers,   aggregationFactor,   startDate,   countryCodeISO3C,   incidenceData = NULL,   deathData = NULL,   simulationIsDeterministic = TRUE,   dataAssimilationEnabled = FALSE,   healthZoneCoordinates,   variableCovarianceFunction,   Q.backgroundErrorStandardDeviation,   Q.characteristicCorrelationLength,   neighbourhood,   psi.diagonal,   callback = `{` )

title: SVEIRD compartmental model with optional Bayesian data assimilation — SVEIRD.BayesianDataAssimilation
text: alpha rate vaccination (per day) beta rate exposure (per day) gamma rate becoming infectious (per day) sigma rate recovery (per day) delta fatality rate (per day) n.days number days simulation run , beginning startDate. seedData dataframe, described initialInfections.fourCities. neighbourhood.order order queen's neighbourhood distribute Exposed Infected intial state variable; zero neighbourhood, corresponds cell queen already . Higher orders follow simple formula (2 * x + 1)^2 determine number cells evenly disperse exposed infected state variables. state variables placed directly grid cell corresponding health zone. lambda average dialy movement distance individual (kilometers). layers SpatRaster object SVEIRD compartment layers, layer classifying habitation. Created getSVEIRD.SpatRaster function. aggregationFactor number adjacent cells one direction aggregate single cell. aggregation factor must used generate SpatRaster layers. startDate date (YYYY-MM-DD format) simulation begins. countryCodeISO3C ISO three character code recognized country. incidenceData "situation report" dataframe. first column provides date officially reported, observed incidence disease, ISO format (YYYY-MM-DD). MAYBE TODO: enforce startDate parameter one week prior first observed data? deathData Data format incidenceData, observations represent deaths, infections. simulationIsDeterministic Whether stochasticity enabled ; simulation deterministic stochastic processes used simulation entirely deterministic. Either TRUE FALSE. dataAssimilationEnabled Whether Bayesian data assimilation used state reporting data. healthZoneCoordinates coordinates health zones country interest, TODO: describe use data users understand must include ; e.g. (used group summarize compartmental model data end simmulation.) variableCovarianceFunction Passed directly Q.forecastErrorCov() generate Q matrix. Q.backgroundErrorStandardDeviation TODO Q.characteristicCorrelationLength TODO neighbourhood TODO psi.diagonal TODO callback callback function run, arguments, called every time main loop simulation iterates.

title: SVEIRD compartmental model with optional Bayesian data assimilation — SVEIRD.BayesianDataAssimilation
text: summaryTable dataframe simulation, showing changes compartment values time, daily values, cumulative values.

title: SVEIRD compartmental model with optional Bayesian data assimilation — SVEIRD.BayesianDataAssimilation
text: TODO: DETAILS function.

title: SVEIRD compartmental model with optional Bayesian data assimilation — SVEIRD.BayesianDataAssimilation
text: Bryce Carson Ashok Krishnmaurthy Michael Myer

title: SVEIRD compartmental model with optional Bayesian data assimilation — SVEIRD.BayesianDataAssimilation
code: subregionsSpatVector <- terra::vect(   system.file(     "extdata",     ## COD: Nord-Kivu and Ituri (Democratic Republic of Congo)     "subregionsSpatVector",     package = "spatialEpisim.foundation",     mustWork = TRUE   ) ) susceptibleSpatRaster <- terra::rast(   system.file(     "extdata",     "susceptibleSpatRaster.tif", # Congo population     package = "spatialEpisim.foundation",     mustWork = TRUE   ) ) data("healthZonesCongo", package = "spatialEpisim.foundation") data("initialInfections.fourCities", package = "spatialEpisim.foundation") data("Congo.EbolaIncidence", package = "spatialEpisim.foundation") SVEIRD.BayesianDataAssimilation(   ## Parameters   alpha = 3.5e-5,   beta = 7e-3,   gamma = 1/7,   sigma = 1/36,   delta = 2/36,   lambda = 15,   ## Model runtime   n.days = 31, # a month, permitting three assimilations of observed data   ## Model data   seedData = initialInfections.fourCities,   neighbourhood.order = 1,   layers = getSVEIRD.SpatRaster(subregionsSpatVector,                                 susceptibleSpatRaster,                                 aggregationFactor = 35),   aggregationFactor = 35,   startDate = "2018-08-05",   countryCodeISO3C = "COD",   incidenceData = Congo.EbolaIncidence,   ## Model options   simulationIsDeterministic = TRUE,   dataAssimilationEnabled = TRUE,   healthZoneCoordinates = healthZonesCongo,   variableCovarianceFunction = "DBD",   ## Special parameters   Q.backgroundErrorStandardDeviation = 0.55,   Q.characteristicCorrelationLength = 6.75e-1,   neighbourhood = 3,   psi.diagonal = 1e-3 ) #> Susceptible before seeding = 126108 #> Susceptible after seeding = 6461 #> Warning: Raster aggregation factor is too high to differentiate between two (or more) health zones (they correspond to the same grid cell). #> Error: [focal] not a meanigful window

title: Bayesian data assimilation — assimilateData
text: Assimilation data (Bayesian) using optimal statistical inference, modified Kalman Filter.

title: Bayesian data assimilation — assimilateData
code: assimilateData(   layers,   linearInterpolationMatrix,   incidenceData,   healthZoneCoordinates,   psi.diagonal,   QHt,   HQHt )

title: Bayesian data assimilation — assimilateData
text: layers SpatRaster object layers Susceptible, Vaccinated, Exposed, Infected, Recovered, Dead. linearInterpolationMatrix linear forward interpolation operator matrix many columns cells SpatRaster layers, many rows health zones coordinates provided (creating matrix use one state vector). matrix either trivial matrix described elsewhere (see linearInterpolationOperator), two partitions sparse, block diagonal matrix. incidenceData "situation report" dataframe. first column provides date officially reported, observed incidence disease, ISO format (YYYY-MM-DD). MAYBE TODO: enforce startDate parameter one week prior first observed data? healthZoneCoordinates table values giving latitude longitude coordinates health zones country interest. See description healthZoneCoordinates argument function SVEIRD.BayesianDataAssimilation details. psi.diagonal TODO QHt TODO HQHt TODO

title: Bayesian data assimilation — assimilateData
text: list SpatRasters, Infected Exposed SpatRasters

title: Bayesian data assimilation — assimilateData
text: Bryce Carson

title: Average Euclidean Distance — averageEuclideanDistance
text: Measure exposure influence upon susceptible individuals spatial position (x, y) infectious individuals spatial position (u, v).

title: Average Euclidean Distance — averageEuclideanDistance
text: lambda average dialy movement distance individual (kilometers). aggregationFactor factor aggregation applied raster data mentioned function details (expressed kilometers). epsilon rounding error correction (real number; default, zero).

title: Average Euclidean Distance — averageEuclideanDistance
text: matrix average Euclidean distances

title: Average Euclidean Distance — averageEuclideanDistance
text: 2020 United Nations-adjusted population count raster data, 30-arc second resolution, consists hundreds thousands (countries millions) grid cells. function used calculate average Euclidean distance one cell others, adjusting raster aggregation. mathematical modelling human non-human mobility patterns non-trivial. function limited implementation effective area human mobility, distances travelled per day (lambda) measured kilometers. NOTE: weight function take arguments shown slideshow: (w x y u v); term "effective area" comes fact kernel constant finite disk (zero outside ), formula due Bolker (1999) gives area disk. See article titled clarification transmission terms host-microparasite models Begon et al. (2002). count infected persons, incidence, raster data provided caller function, .e. transmissionLikelihoodWeightings, may aggregated given factor greater one, aggregationFactor; passed regardless.

title: Average Euclidean Distance — averageEuclideanDistance
text: Bryce Carson Thomas White

text: seedData dataframe like following example; compartment columns initial values. neighbourhood.order order queen's neighbourhood distribute Exposed Infected intial state variable; zero neighbourhood, corresponds cell queen already . Higher orders follow simple formula (2 * x + 1)^2 determine number cells evenly disperse exposed infected state variables. state variables placed directly grid cell corresponding health zone. layers SpatRaster object layers Susceptible, Vaccinated, Exposed, Infected, Recovered, Dead.

title: Seed the initial infections, and other compartments, in a spatial simluation — castSeedDataQueensNeighbourhood
text: Bryce Carson

title: Seed the initial infections, and other compartments, in a spatial simluation — castSeedDataQueensNeighbourhood
code: subregionsSpatVector <- terra::vect(   system.file(     "extdata",     ## COD: Nord-Kivu and Ituri (Democratic Republic of Congo)     "subregionsSpatVector",     package = "spatialEpisim.foundation",     mustWork = TRUE   ) ) susceptibleSpatRaster <- terra::rast(   system.file(     "extdata",     "susceptibleSpatRaster.tif", # Congo population     package = "spatialEpisim.foundation",     mustWork = TRUE   ) ) layers <- getSVEIRD.SpatRaster(subregionsSpatVector,                                susceptibleSpatRaster,                                aggregationFactor = 35) data(initialInfections.fourCities, package = "spatialEpisim.foundation") plot(castSeedDataQueensNeighbourhood(initialInfections.fourCities, 0, layers)) #> Error in !missing(from) && !is.finite(if (is.character(from)) from <- as.numeric(from) else from): invalid 'y' type in 'x && y' castSeedDataQueensNeighbourhood(initialInfections.fourCities, 1, layers) #> Error in !missing(from) && !is.finite(if (is.character(from)) from <- as.numeric(from) else from): invalid 'y' type in 'x && y' plot(castSeedDataQueensNeighbourhood(initialInfections.fourCities, 3, layers)) #> Error in !missing(from) && !is.finite(if (is.character(from)) from <- as.numeric(from) else from): invalid 'y' type in 'x && y'

title: Download WorldPop 2020 data — downloadWorldPopData
text: function downloads file necessary (exist path). ppp code used WorldPop mean population estimate population counts; similar data, grids population density coded pd rather ppp. 1km means 1 km aggregation data. description WorldPop gives data "individual countries 2000-2020 UN adjusted aggregated 1km resolution using 100m resolution population count datasets". See: https://hub.worldpop.org/doi/10.5258/SOTON/WP00671.

title: Get a country's GADM verison 3.6 raster — getCountrySubregions.SpatVector
code: library(geodata) #> Loading required package: terra #> terra 1.7.78 geodata_path_backup <- geodata_path() options(geodata_default_path = getOption("spatialEpisim.foundation.datapath")) getCountrySubregions.SpatVector("COD", c("Nord-Kivu", "Ituri")) #>  class       : SpatVector  #>  geometry    : polygons  #>  dimensions  : 2, 10  (geometries, attributes) #>  extent      : 27.22714, 31.30572, -2.06577, 3.674677  (xmin, xmax, ymin, ymax) #>  coord. ref. : +proj=longlat +ellps=WGS84 +towgs84=0,0,0,0,0,0,0 +no_defs  #>  names       : GID_0          NAME_0    GID_1    NAME_1 VARNAME_1 NL_NAME_1 #>  type        : <chr>           <chr>    <chr>     <chr>     <chr>     <chr> #>  values      :   COD Democratic Rep~  COD.6_1     Ituri        NA        NA #>                  COD Democratic Rep~ COD.19_1 Nord-Kivu        NA        NA #>    TYPE_1 ENGTYPE_1  CC_1 HASC_1 #>     <chr>     <chr> <chr>  <chr> #>  Province  Province    NA  CD.IT #>  Province  Province    NA  CD.NK getCountrySubregions.SpatVector("CZE", "Prague") #>  class       : SpatVector  #>  geometry    : polygons  #>  dimensions  : 1, 10  (geometries, attributes) #>  extent      : 14.25095, 14.71854, 49.93997, 50.17131  (xmin, xmax, ymin, ymax) #>  coord. ref. : +proj=longlat +ellps=WGS84 +towgs84=0,0,0,0,0,0,0 +no_defs  #>  names       : GID_0         NAME_0    GID_1 NAME_1       VARNAME_1 NL_NAME_1 #>  type        : <chr>          <chr>    <chr>  <chr>           <chr>     <chr> #>  values      :   CZE Czech Republic CZE.11_1 Prague Prag |Hlavní m~        NA #>  TYPE_1 ENGTYPE_1  CC_1 HASC_1 #>   <chr>     <chr> <chr>  <chr> #>    Kraj    Region    NA  CZ.SK getCountrySubregions.SpatVector("NGA", "Kwara") #>  class       : SpatVector  #>  geometry    : polygons  #>  dimensions  : 1, 10  (geometries, attributes) #>  extent      : 2.728413, 6.210898, 7.965384, 10.15013  (xmin, xmax, ymin, ymax) #>  coord. ref. : +proj=longlat +ellps=WGS84 +towgs84=0,0,0,0,0,0,0 +no_defs  #>  names       : GID_0  NAME_0    GID_1 NAME_1 VARNAME_1 NL_NAME_1 TYPE_1 #>  type        : <chr>   <chr>    <chr>  <chr>     <chr>     <chr>  <chr> #>  values      :   NGA Nigeria NGA.24_1  Kwara        NA        NA  State #>  ENGTYPE_1  CC_1 HASC_1 #>      <chr> <chr>  <chr> #>      State    NA  NG.KW options(geodata_default_path = geodata_path_backup)

title: Create a SpatRaster of SVEIRD model compartment raster data — getSVEIRD.SpatRaster
text: Bryce Carson Michael Myer Ashok Krishnmaurthy

title: Create a SpatRaster of SVEIRD model compartment raster data — getSVEIRD.SpatRaster
code: subregionsSpatVector <- terra::vect(   system.file(     "extdata",     ## COD: Nord-Kivu and Ituri (Democratic Republic of Congo)     "subregionsSpatVector",     package = "spatialEpisim.foundation",     mustWork = TRUE   ) ) susceptibleSpatRaster <- terra::rast(   system.file(     "extdata",     "susceptibleSpatRaster.tif", # Congo population     package = "spatialEpisim.foundation",     mustWork = TRUE   ) ) getSVEIRD.SpatRaster(subregionsSpatVector, susceptibleSpatRaster,                      aggregationFactor = 35) #> class       : SpatRaster  #> dimensions  : 20, 14, 6  (nrow, ncol, nlyr) #> resolution  : 0.2916667, 0.2916667  (x, y) #> extent      : 27.22375, 31.30708, -2.15875, 3.674584  (xmin, xmax, ymin, ymax) #> coord. ref. : lon/lat WGS 84 (EPSG:4326)  #> source(s)   : memory #> names       : Susceptible, Vaccinated, Exposed, Infected, Recovered, Dead  #> min values  :           0,        NaN,     NaN,      NaN,       NaN,  NaN  #> max values  :        5211,        NaN,     NaN,      NaN,       NaN,  NaN   ## Omitting the aggregation factor argument will prevent aggregation. An ## aggregation factor of zero or one is meaningless and will produce an ## error. getSVEIRD.SpatRaster(subregionsSpatVector, susceptibleSpatRaster) #> class       : SpatRaster  #> dimensions  : 689, 487, 6  (nrow, ncol, nlyr) #> resolution  : 0.008333333, 0.008333333  (x, y) #> extent      : 27.22375, 31.28208, -2.067083, 3.674584  (xmin, xmax, ymin, ymax) #> coord. ref. : lon/lat WGS 84 (EPSG:4326)  #> source(s)   : memory #> varnames    : susceptibleSpatRaster  #>               susceptibleSpatRaster  #> names       : Susceptible, Vaccinated, Exposed, Infected, Recovered, Dead  #> min values  :           0,        NaN,     NaN,      NaN,       NaN,  NaN  #> max values  :           6,        NaN,     NaN,      NaN,       NaN,  NaN

code: library(geodata) geodata_path_backup <- geodata_path() options(geodata_default_path = getOption("spatialEpisim.foundation.datapath")) lvl1AdminBorders("COD") #>  class       : SpatVector  #>  geometry    : polygons  #>  dimensions  : 26, 10  (geometries, attributes) #>  extent      : 12.20663, 31.30572, -13.45568, 5.386098  (xmin, xmax, ymin, ymax) #>  coord. ref. : +proj=longlat +ellps=WGS84 +towgs84=0,0,0,0,0,0,0 +no_defs  #>  names       : GID_0          NAME_0   GID_1       NAME_1 VARNAME_1 NL_NAME_1 #>  type        : <chr>           <chr>   <chr>        <chr>     <chr>     <chr> #>  values      :   COD Democratic Rep~ COD.1_1     Bas-Uélé        NA        NA #>                  COD Democratic Rep~ COD.2_1     Équateur        NA        NA #>                  COD Democratic Rep~ COD.3_1 Haut-Katanga        NA        NA #>    TYPE_1 ENGTYPE_1  CC_1 HASC_1 #>     <chr>     <chr> <chr>  <chr> #>  Province  Province    NA  CD.BU #>  Province  Province    NA  CD.ET #>  Province  Province    NA  CD.HK options(geodata_default_path = geodata_path_backup)  if (FALSE) { # \dontrun{ ## It's recommended to set geodata_default_path in your .Rprofile rather ## than explicitly provide the path. lvl1AdminBorders("COD", file.path("data", "gadm")) } # }

title: Plot a raster cropped to sub-region(s) of a country — maskAndClassifySusceptibleSpatRaster
code: library(lattice) subregionsSpatVector <- terra::vect(   system.file(     "extdata",     ## COD: Nord-Kivu and Ituri (Democratic Republic of Congo)     "subregionsSpatVector",     package = "spatialEpisim.foundation",     mustWork = TRUE   ) ) susceptibleSpatRaster <- terra::rast(   system.file(     "extdata",     "susceptibleSpatRaster.tif", # Congo population     package = "spatialEpisim.foundation",     mustWork = TRUE   ) ) masked <- maskAndClassifySusceptibleSpatRaster(subregionsSpatVector,                                                susceptibleSpatRaster) terra::plot(masked)   if (FALSE) { # \dontrun{ maskAndClassifySusceptibleSpatRaster(getSubregion("CZE", "Prague"),                                      getCountryPopulation.SpatRaster("CZE"))  maskAndClassifySusceptibleSpatRaster(getSubregion("NGA", "Lagos"),                                      getCountryPopulation.SpatRaster("NGA"))  maskAndClassifySusceptibleSpatRaster(getSubregion("COD", "Ituri"),                                      getCountryPopulation.SpatRaster("COD"))  maskAndClassifySusceptibleSpatRaster(getSubregion("COD", c("Nord-Kivu", "Ituri")),                                      getCountryPopulation.SpatRaster("COD")) } # }

title: Setup Bayesian data assimilation — setupBayesianDataAssimilation
text: Using provided parameters SpatRaster, necessary setup functions values Bayesian data assimilation called, values used later returned.

title: Setup Bayesian data assimilation — setupBayesianDataAssimilation
code: setupBayesianDataAssimilation(   layers,   healthZoneCoordinates,   compartmentsReported,   variableCovarianceFunction,   Q.backgroundErrorStandardDeviation,   Q.characteristicCorrelationLength,   neighbourhood )

title: Setup Bayesian data assimilation — setupBayesianDataAssimilation
text: layers SpatRaster following layers: Susceptible, Vaccinated, Exposed, Infected, Recovered, Dead. healthZoneCoordinates dataframe three columns, location name, latitude, longitude describing geographical locations reporting health zones. compartmentsReported number compartments epidemic states reported ; either one two. Higher numbers supported. One corresponds infection, two compartments corresponds exposure infection. variableCovarianceFunction function calculate error covariance, returned Q.forecastErrorCov. Q.backgroundErrorStandardDeviation "background" default amount error, standard deviations. Q.characteristicCorrelationLength TODO neighbourhood TODO

title: Setup Bayesian data assimilation — setupBayesianDataAssimilation
text: HQHt matrix

title: Setup Bayesian data assimilation — setupBayesianDataAssimilation

what: spatialEpisim.foundation: Spatial, Compartmental Epidemic Simulations with Exposure, Vaccination, and Bayesian Data Assimilation for 'spatialEpisim' — spatialEpisim.foundation-package
title: spatialEpisim.foundation: Spatial, Compartmental Epidemic Simulations with Exposure, Vaccination, and Bayesian Data Assimilation for 'spatialEpisim' — spatialEpisim.foundation-package
text: Spatial epidemic simulations using SVEIRD compartmental epidemic models (Susceptible, Vaccinated, Exposed, Infected, Recovered, Dead) allow mathematical modelling epidemics using traditional, modified SIR (Susceptible, Infected, Recovered) compartmental models invented Kermack McKendrick 1927. Spatial dynamics extend SVEIRD modelling process software. 'spatialEpisim' 'Shiny' application built 'spatialEpisim.foundation'. sources originated , now live provide validation documenation vignettes, tests, et cetera.

title: spatialEpisim.foundation: Spatial, Compartmental Epidemic Simulations with Exposure, Vaccination, and Bayesian Data Assimilation for 'spatialEpisim' — spatialEpisim.foundation-package
text: Maintainer: Ashok Krishnamurthy akrishnamurthy@mtroyal.ca (ORCID) [copyright holder, contributor] Authors: Bryce Carson bcars268@mtroyal.ca (ORCID) contributors: Alberta Innovates [funder]

title: Weighted Sums — transmissionLikelihoodWeightings
text: Calculate matrix weights respecting human mobility patterns.

title: Weighted Sums — transmissionLikelihoodWeightings
text: infections matrix count infections per aggregate area raster terrestrial data. lambda average dialy movement distance individual (kilometers). aggregationFactor number adjacent cells one direction aggregate single cell. aggregation factor must used generate SpatRaster layers.

title: Weighted Sums — transmissionLikelihoodWeightings
text: matrix weightings calculation proportionOfSusceptible exposed individuals become infectious.

title: Weighted Sums — transmissionLikelihoodWeightings
text: pattern human mobility used described slideshow : https://docs.google.com/presentation/d/1_gqcEh4d8yRy22tCZkU0MbGYSsGu3Djh/edit?usp=sharing&ouid=102231457806738400087&rtpof=true&sd=true.

title: Weighted Sums — transmissionLikelihoodWeightings
text: Bryce Carson Thomas White

title: Weighted Sums — transmissionLikelihoodWeightings
code: library(terra) subregionsSpatVector <- vect(   system.file(     "extdata",     ## COD: Nord-Kivu and Ituri (Democratic Republic of Congo)     "subregionsSpatVector",     package = "spatialEpisim.foundation",     mustWork = TRUE   ) ) susceptibleSpatRaster <- rast(   system.file(     "extdata",     "susceptibleSpatRaster.tif", # Congo population     package = "spatialEpisim.foundation",     mustWork = TRUE   ) ) layers <- getSVEIRD.SpatRaster(subregionsSpatVector,                                susceptibleSpatRaster,                                aggregationFactor = 35) transmissionLikelihoodWeightings(layers$Infected, 15, 35) #> Error: [focal] not a meanigful window
